SENT.plain: The association of soft tissue and bony overgrowth, varicose veins and port-wine nevus is known as Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome
An unusual case of a young woman with this syndrome is presented
In addition to the classic features she had face swelling, bilateral limb involvement and an infected cutaneous lymphangioma
No evidence of arteriovenous fistula was demonstrated
In contrast to an abnormal lymphatic system the deep veins of the limbs were normal
Unilateral lung lesions were demonstrated which have not been described previously in such cases
